document_data.name: The Maiden Danced at Dawn
document_data.mainbody: '''The Maiden Danced at Dawn''' was a small [[inn]] located in the hamlet of [[Dawngleam]] in [[Cormyr]] around [[1368 DR]].
document_data.Description: The rooms of the inn were somewhat cramped. Humidity was an issue and the inn always felt damp.
document_data.Activities:
The inn was renowned, at least locally, for a brandy made in-house called [[Maiden's Kiss]]. A flask of Maiden's Kiss cost 5 [[silver pieces]].

Simple fare consisting of [[sausage]], [[bread]], [[biscuit]]s, and nut cakes could be had at the rate of 4 [[copper piece]]s per plate. A selection of [[ale]]s and stouts were available, as well as a decent assortment of [[wine]]s.
